result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert J Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.
Concurrent with: with time now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time, verifiable, taxable employment.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with time now serving

Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Albert J Chavez in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Albert J Chavez in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Albert J Chavez in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Albert J Chavez in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
